message.content:
1. The most common grade 3–4 adverse event in patients evaluated for chemotherapy toxicity was neutropenia.
2. There were 266 patients in the twice-daily group.
3. There were 263 patients in the once-daily group.
4. 197 patients in the twice-daily group experienced neutropenia.
5. 170 patients in the once-daily group experienced neutropenia.
6. The percentage of patients who experienced neutropenia in the twice-daily group was 74%.
7. The percentage of patients who experienced neutropenia in the once-daily group was 65%.

messages.content:
Statement: The most common grade 3–4 adverse event in patients evaluated for chemotherapy toxicity was neutropenia (197 [74%] of 266 patients in the twice-daily group vs 170 [65%] of 263 in the once-daily group).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
